page.title: 11QUEEN MARY RESERVOIR
page.content: There are lots of reservoirs around Staines.The{Queen Mary}has the largest surface area of all of them. It is filled from the Thames and then pumped out from a pumphouse beneath the embankment.The pumps used to be coal fired but are now electric.They move about 80_90 million gallons of water a day.This is nearly enough for 0.25 of London. The bank is 4 miles around and about 1 mile across.There is a big wall called a "Baffle" about 0.75 of the way across the reservoir to stop the waves getting too big. During the Second World War an attempt was made to break the banking.It was not successful but a bomber with half a load of bombs crashed into the water.It has been located but will not be moved until more gravel has been extracted.
